trans-unit.source: Represents an expression that has a conditional operator.
Use the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.Condition%2A> factory method to create a <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ConditionalExpression>.
The <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.NodeType%2A> of a <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ConditionalExpression> is <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Conditional>.
Dispatches to the specific visit method for this node type.

For example, <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.MethodCallExpression"></xref> calls the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitMethodCall(System.Linq.Expressions.MethodCallExpression)"></xref>.
This default implementation for <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension> nodes calls <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.
Override this method to call into a more specific method on a derived visitor class of the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor> class.
However, it should still support unknown visitors by calling <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.
The visitor to visit this node with.
The result of visiting this node.
Gets the expression to execute if the test evaluates to `false`.
An <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> that represents the expression to execute if the test is `false`.
Gets the expression to execute if the test evaluates to `true`.
An <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> that represents the expression to execute if the test is `true`.
Returns the node type of this expression.
Extension nodes should return <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension"></xref> when overriding this method.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType"></xref> of the expression.
Gets the test of the conditional operation.
An <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> that represents the test of the conditional operation.
Gets the static type of the expression that this <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> represents.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ConditionalExpression.Type"></xref> that represents the static type of the expression.
Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children.
If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ConditionalExpression.Test"></xref> property of the result.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ConditionalExpression.IfTrue"></xref> property of the result.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ConditionalExpression.IfFalse"></xref> property of the result.
This expression if no children changed, or an expression with the updated children.
